intro: Psychotria horizontalis, commonly known as the "Red-eyed" Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Psychotria horizontalis is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
